questions.question: The boy ……………………. the girl is guilty.
questions.description: The verb is singular when you connect two singular nouns with as well as. Or you can write 'The boy and the girl are guilty.'

questions.question: ……………………… being rich, he does not help anyone.
questions.description: Despite is a preposition it is followed by a noun or ing form.

questions.question: He tried hard ……………………, he could not succeed.
questions.description: However is not a conjunction use a semicolon or a full stop before however.

questions.question: He won’t marry ………………………. he gets a good job.
You must work hard ……………………. you will fail.
She ought to be here soon …………………….. she left office at
questions.description: For can mean because in a more formal style.

questions.question: ………………………. she is intelligent she is lazy.
questions.description: Though is a conjunction used to connect two contrasting ideas.

questions.question: …………………… he was not feeling well, they took him to hospital.
Tomorrow is a holiday, ……………………. he will be at home.
I last visited my parents five months …………………..
This is the school ……………………. he studied.
It has been months …………………….. it rained.
